physical_appearance:\The map is rectangular in shape and there is a white boundary separating it from the brown frame. The map is separated into a larger part and a smaller one. There are two different sets of scales used in this map. On the upper left hand corner is the smaller parts
 with a scale of \\1: 100
subject_terms_1:000\\. It shows the Singapore Harbour as well as Pulau Blakang Mati and Pulau Brani. The scale of the bigger map inhabited places villages islands (landforms) landmarks
subject_terms_2:\\1: 18500\\ Singapore River (Singapore) Human settlements Villages Islands Street names
subject_terms_3:is stated at the bottom right hand corner. It features the Singapore River as well as other areas such as kampungs Pulau Brani Sentosa Streets and Places
subject_terms_4:man-made and natural landmarks. Street names are also stated accordingly. There are also tiny drawings in red on the map to represent the spatial layout of buildings and settlements.\

metadata.physical_appearance: "The map is rectangular in shape and there is a white boundary separating it from the brown frame. The map is separated into a larger part and a smaller one. There are two different sets of scales used in this map. On the upper left hand corner is the smaller parts, with a scale of ""1: 100
metadata.subject_terms_1: 000"". It shows the Singapore Harbour as well as Pulau Blakang Mati and Pulau Brani. The scale of the bigger map inhabited places villages islands (landforms) landmarks
metadata.subject_terms_2: ""1: 18500"" Singapore River (Singapore) Human settlements Villages Islands Street names
metadata.subject_terms_3: is stated at the bottom right hand corner. It features the Singapore River as well as other areas such as kampungs Pulau Brani Sentosa Streets and Places
metadata.subject_terms_4: man-made and natural landmarks. Street names are also stated accordingly. There are also tiny drawings in red on the map to represent the spatial layout of buildings and settlements."
